msbt.message: Huh? Sorry, I'm a little busy right now
Oh, sorry Now's not a good time.
Oh. Hey, . Sorry, but I can't pause this right now. We'll talk later.
Good to see you, . Sorry I can't chat I'm right in the middle of a thing.
Oh, hello, . Sorry to brush you off— my claws are pretty full
Sorry. Can't talk.
If you need something, could you talk to the other hedgehog, please?
Sorry, I kinda have to focus on this so I don't wreck it
Hey, Mabes, could you help this customer, please?
Oh! <20_2 arg="8" />Hey, sorry about that! <20_2 arg="4" />When Sable's really focused, she gets a little, y'know, prickly.
No talking—only sewing.
<20_2 arg="8" />Oh, whoops!<20_2 arg="4" /> I'm happy to help you with whatever you need. Just step away from the seamstress
Hey, um, it's great that you're such a loyal customer and everything, butI've just got a TON of work to get through. Thanks for understanding!
Hey, I'm kind of sewn into my machine right now Sorry I can't chat, but, uh, thanks for stopping by.
Uh, like I said before, I appreciate the visit, but I'm just buried in work right now.
Mabes. Hey, Mabes! I've got a customer who needs help here.
<20_2 arg="8" />Hm? Oh, of course! <20_2 arg="4" />Whatever you need, I can help you out right over here!
Um You're, right?
<20_2 arg="7" />Wait, what just happened?I don't think I've ever heard you call a customer by name before, Sis!
<20_2 arg="5" />Hush, Mabel! You know this is hard for me.<20_2 arg="6" />Anyway, I'm Sable. I figured it was time we were introduced properly. Y-you can go back to shopping now
Sorry we can't offer you a cup of tea or anything, but we're always happy to have you here.
It's nice that you always go out of your way to stop by and see us, .

<20_2 arg="6" />Oh! Hello, ! You seem prettychipper.You're always making the effort to stop by, and I can't so much as offer you a cup of tea. I'm sorry.If we had just one more pair of claws around here to help out, I might be able to chat more

<20_2 arg="7" />Oh, not this again! C'mon, Sable, you gotta stop torturing yourself like this. <20_2 arg="8" />Our sister, Label, went out into the world to pursue her dream of being a big-time designer. And we promised her we'd work like hedgedogs to take care of the shop while she's gone. <20_2 arg="7" />Remember, Sis?

<20_2 arg="5" />How could I forget when I've got you? But you're right, Mabes— I'll get my head out of the clouds. <20_2 arg="6" />That said, , I can't offer sparkling conversation, but I hope you'll keep stopping by anyway.
<20_2 arg="6" />If you see anything you like, Mabel can help you out.
<20_2 arg="6" />It means a lot to me and Mabel that you always make the time to stop by, .
Ah, ! Welcome back!It's, um, nice of you to keep supporting Able Sisters so we canbe the best shop we can be!

<20_2 arg="7" />Oh, right—looks like your favorite customer came by again today, Sable!<20_3 arg="8" />Every day for like a week, it's been, "Do you think will stop by today?"And I'm all, "Sis, confine your spines—we're not even open yet!"
<20_2 arg="5" />M-Mabel!
Don't worry, Sis! is too nice to ever make fun of you. Right, ?
Um. Thanks for being such a loyal customer, .

A lot of my work has to be done pretty precisely, so my shoulders get real stiff. But today, after we close up shop, Mabel's giving me a back rub!<10_4 /><20_2 arg="5" /> You didn't forget, did you, Mabel?<20_2 arg="4" />

<20_3 arg="7" />Eh, sis, I don't knowhedgehog backrubs are no joke, and my protective gloves wore through Oh, I'm totally kidding! <20_3 arg="8" />Unlike ol' Gray-ble there, I'm still pretty young and spry. I can handle it!
MABEL!<20_2 arg="3" />
Oops! That was too much, huh?<20_2 arg="4" /> Er, sorry, Sis!

Welcome, ! Sorry that, as usual, I can't really stop and chat. We're always a little short-clawed around here, since it's just the two of us running the place. I think we told you that our other sister, Label, used to work with us at our old shop? Now she's on her own, working hard to be a big-time fashion designer, and we couldn't be prouder of her.
And before that, for a while, <20_2 arg="8" />Label<20_2 arg="4" /> was training with a famous designer!It's been a long time since the three of us lived under one roofbut those were good times!

<20_2 arg="5" />They really were, weren't they?<20_2 arg="3" /><20_3 arg="7" /> There was always so much going on, for better or worseMabes, remember when you ate that ice cream that Label had hidden behind the peas? Oh, she was MAD!
H-hey! Come on, sis—not in front of !

<20_2 arg="5" />Heehee! We'll call that payback for last time.<20_2 arg="6" />In any case,<20_2 arg="3" /> it is a little sad that we're back to living apart againBut, more than anything, we both want to do whatever we can to support our sister and her dreams.
Absolutely right, Sis!<20_2 arg="4" /> After all, any dream of Label's is our dream too!
Label stops by the store sometimes, even as busy as she is. I probably fuss over her too much I just think it's my responsibility to make sure she always has a place to come home to.
I never asked how YOU'RE doing, ?

We ran another tailor shop like this in a different place before we came here. That was the shop our late parents left us.But then Label went on her journey, and all of our other friends set off to try new things. So we decided to get a fresh start too. That's how we came to be here on !
<20_2 arg="7" />And coming here<20_2 arg="2" /> was totally the right call! It's fun, the scenery is great and you can't beat the neighbors! But I have to admit, I do miss our old store sometimes

I do too<20_2 arg="3" /><20_3 arg="7" /> We ran that old place for quite a while, so it's filled with good memories. But it's still there, and we can visit it whenever, so let's just focus on making our new shop even better!
Good point, Sis! Let's keep working hard!

Good old Mabes She's really giving it her all.<20_2 arg="6" />I have to admit I know just what she means about missing our old shop, but at the same time I'm so, so glad we came to this island. I finally feel like we have a family again.
I wish I had more to offer for hospitality. You'll just have to settle for "family time."
, thanks so much for always stopping by. You're definitely part of our new family.
<20_2 arg="8" />Totally!<20_2 arg="4" /> You're, like, our sibling with different quilling! Thanks a bunch!

Oh, if it isn't ! Welcome.You're always stopping by and I can never stop working and have a proper chat. Sorry about that!Hm? The photos behind me? They're of me and my sisters when we were youngerand our parents. They both passed away years ago, but these pictures bring back lots of good memories.

<20_2 arg="8" />I was pretty young<20_2 arg="2" /> when they died, so I don't remember them all that well <20_2 arg="7" />What I do remember is Sable doing her best to raise me all on her own. Thanks, Sis. <10_4 />Sorry I was such a pain.
<20_2 arg="3" />Are you feeling OK, Mabes? What happened to calling me "Gray-ble" and making fun of my apron?
<20_2 arg="4" />Come on, Sis! I'm trying to have a moment here!It's not like we ever talk about this stuff without to play referee! Don't be mean!

<20_2 arg="3" />I'm sorry. That was out of line.And you're right—we should talk more. You're an adult now and I need to treat you like one. AndI'm really proud of you, Mabes. You're a lot of things I could never be, little sister. I took care of you and Label when you were younger, but now we can all watch out for each other. And when the Able Sisters work side-by-side, there's nothing we can't do!
It's amazing how the day just zooms by when I'm sitting at this sewing machine! I work hard, but I love what I do, so I can't really complain about much.
I don't know why, but I seem to be working faster today than usual. Maybe I'll finish early!
You making your usual rounds, , or is this a special visit?
<20_2 arg="8" />Not that you ever need a reason to visit your favorite hedgehog shopkeepers!
Oh, hi there, ! What are you looking for today?
<20_2 arg="8" />Not so fast! If you wanna buy something at THIS store, you go through ME!
, what kind of clothing do you usually like? How would you describe your style?
<20_2 arg="7" />Ooh! I'll bet I know! You're all about likea green and white checkered patternmaybe on an apron
<20_2 arg="5" />Mabes. You're doing the thing where you think everyone is you again.
You know the tapestry hanging on the left wall over there? It belonged to our mother. Every time I look at it, I get this warm feeling insidelike when she would hug me.
Well, it's Monday. Back to the fabric mines.

Out of all the days of the week, Tuesdays tend to drag the most, so I need to do my best to stay sharp. "If the tailor made a mistake, they probably did it on a Tuesday."At least, that's what Mama always used to say
Hey, we made it to Wednesday, halfway through the week!I always figure that if you can get to Wednesday, the rest of the week is easy. It's like sewing downhill!
Oh, it's Thursday! That means a new episode of my favorite porcupine true-crime show, Pointed Questions. I hope the DA will lay off this week. He's always badgering the witnesses.
Happy Friday, . Any big plans for the weekend?Me? Oh, I thought I'd get some sewing in, try to get a jump on next week's work.

I know what you're thinking. "Why is Sable here working every Saturday?"I actually get the most done on Saturdays. I like feeling productive when everyone else is resting! And Papa always told me, "Stitching overtime can save your spines!"
It makes me so happy that you'd come all this way to see us, even on a Sunday. You want to know why? It's because talking with you while I'm working is the best part of my day!
It's sort of silly, since I'm inside the shop all day, but sunny weather helps me work faster. Or maybe it's just that I'm making shorter sleeves?
Cloudy weather always leaves me less motivated. Makes it hard to get all my work done. But sometimes I fight the gloom by only using the brightest colors I can find!
You came all this way in the rain just to come see us? You're the sweetest, !
Looks like it's raining pretty hard out there. Do you have something waterproof to wear?
Look at you, braving the snow to come visit! Be sure to watch your step out there.
Wow. We're going to call this the Great Blizzard of , aren't we?You be sure to dress warmly out there, alright?
Oh, the cherry blossoms are so pretty this time of year!They take me back to picnics under the cherry trees when we were kids Mabel and I should do that again
The weather's been feeling more springlike lately, hasn't it?You may even find that buying new, seasonal clothing putsa SPRING in your step?
We've been having more and more hot days lately—summer is just around the corner. Probably time to get out my collection of summer aprons
Do you have your summer wardrobe all picked out and ready yet?
This summer has been especially hot, hasn't it, ?I'm always in here, but I know it's too warm because we keep selling out of sleeveless clothing!
It's hard to pick an outfit this time of year, since the temperature is so different from morning to afternoon. This is the big advantage to just throwing an apron on 365 days a year!
Do you have some good winter clothes? I worry about you not having any fur
I hear we're expecting an especially chilly winter.I've made a lot of good, warm stuff to choose from—I hope you find something you like.
It's been so c-c-cold. My spines are chattering!Do you ever try to distract yourself from the cold by experimenting with fun, warm outfits? I recommend it!
Seems like it's starting to warm up, finally! Each day is just a bit nicer than the last. Which makes it the perfect time to check out our spring fashions! I was thinking of you when I made them.

I think you've heard Mabel and me talk about our other sister? Label, the fashion designer? She's traveling around a lot right now, studying fashion with different folks. She also comes to this island sometimes, so if you see her, be sure to say hi, OK?

Have you met our other sister, Label, yet? She comes to the island from time to time. She's got big dreams. Sometimes TOO big, if you know what I mean! But I think you'll like her. She can be a little shy around strangersbut I know that's not a problem for you.
Label tells me you've been helping her out, modeling outfits and such.It means a lot to all of us that you do so much for our little family. Thanks so much, .

, I just wanted to say thank you for always being there to help Label. She talks about you all the time, you know. She says the outfits you pick out are always super inspiring. Then she runs back here and starts sketching furiously It's wonderful to see. You've done so much for all three of us. Thank you from the roots of my quills.
Hey, I have a little present for you, .

It's some patterned fabric. I made it myself!You know how you can customize furniture by switching out the parts that are made of fabric? I, um, thought you might want to use my fabric for doing that.I also made lots of different kinds of patterns, so if you see one you like, please feel free to use it!

Any time you're customizing furniture at a work bench, just select Pattern to choose one you like. But it's not like you can use it on ALL furniture. It varies from piece to piece. Iworked really hard making these. I hope you like using them!
Oh, ! I was hoping you'd come by today!I made a new patterned fabric for you to try out on your custom furniture. Here you go!
I started working on these during my breaks from shop stuff, but I got all excited and couldn't stop!
I don't know how much furniture you customize, but I hope this helps!
I made these special for you. I hope you have some fun with them!
